references.paper_title: Adam: A method for stochastic optimization
references.reason: This optimization algorithm is widely used in training deep learning models, including diffusion models, which are central to the paper's methodology.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is used for evaluating the image generation models and assessing their alignment with text prompts, a key aspect of the paper's contributions.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Stable Diffusion, a crucial foundation for the GPS-conditioned diffusion models developed in the current research, improving image generation quality significantly.
DreamFusion provides a vital technique for lifting 3D models from 2D images that is adapted in this work to incorporate GPS information for more localized and context-aware 3D reconstruction.
This foundational paper on diffusion models lays the theoretical groundwork for the image generation techniques used in the current research, enabling high-quality image synthesis from noise.
